Module hanyaeger.api
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api.engine.entities.entity.collisions

Interface Collided

All Superinterfaces:
Anchorable, Bounded, DimensionsProvider, DirectionProvider, GameNode, MotionModifier, Moveable, Placeable, SpeedProvider
All Known Subinterfaces:
SideAwareCollided
public interface Collided
extends Bounded, Moveable
A Collided represents an non-rotatable YaegerEntity that can be collided with by a Collider. In such a case, the Collided is the YaegerEntity that gets notified of the collision.

There are different types of collision detection. In the case of an Collided we perform so called Axis-Aligned Bounding Box collision detection, which required the instances of YaegerEntity to not be Rotatable.

Each Game world Update a Collided is checked against all instances ofCollider. If many instances of Collider are part of the YaegerScene, this could lead to many calculations, which could slow down the game and framerate. Thus ensure only those instances of YaegerEntity that really need to be part of the collision detection implement the Collided or Collider interfaces.

  • Method Details

    • onCollision

      void onCollision​(Collider collidingObject)
      This method is called if a collision has occurred.
      Parameters:
      collidingObject - the EntityCollection you are colliding with

    • checkForCollisions

      default void checkForCollisions​(java.util.List<Collider> colliders)
      Perform collision detection with a Set of Collider instances. Only the first collision is detected.

      In case of a collision, the event handler onCollision(Collider) and Moveable.undoUpdate() are called. From the onCollision(Collider) event handler, it is possible that the speed of the Entity is set to 0. Because the Entity has already been relocated, this relocation should be undone to keep the Entity at the same location. Hence Moveable.undoUpdate() is called, which is responsible for undoing the last relocation.

      Note that all of this takes place during the same Game World update. The re-rendering takes place after this update completes, meaning the undoing will cause no jitter effect.

      Parameters:
      colliders - a Set of colliders that should be checked for collisions
